title: Rupamau
text:
Rupamau is a village in <a href="Amawan">Amawan</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 12 km from <a href="Raebareli">Raebareli</a>, the district headquarters. As of 2011, its population is 6,098, in 1,053 households. It has 4 primary schools and no healthcare facilities.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Rupamau as comprising 20 hamlets, with a total population of 2,372 people (1,204 male and 1,168 female), in 491 households and 467 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 1,940 <a href="acre">acre</a>s and it had a post office at that point.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Rupamau as having a population of 3,119 people, in 589 households, and having an area of 662.09 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were listed as wheat and rice.
